title: How to Make Roast Beef Sirloin

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.Before cooking this dish, you will need to preheat the oven to 245 °C (473 °F) or gas mark 9.
Prepare the meat.
steps.description: Remove fat or sinew. Then, leave the beef to reach room temperature for at least two hours prior to cooking. Mix the mustard, olive oil, and herbs in a bowl. Then smear it all over the surface of the meat until evenly covered. Season the beef with salt and freshly ground black pepper.

steps.headline: Place the beef in the oven.Place the roasting tin in the middle of the oven and leave it for 15 minutes.
steps.description: Make sure the meat is above the tray, so the juices collect in the tray underneath.

steps.headline: Test to see if your beef is ready.
steps.description: For a rare roast, after 15 minutes take the temperature of the meat. It should be around 54 °C (129 °F). For medium rare take the temperature after 20 minutes, it should be around 60 °C (140 °F). For medium , wait 30 minutes and test for 65 °C (149 °F). For well done, 40 minutes and 75 °C (167 °F).

steps.headline: Let the meat sit.Take the beef out and let it sit at room temperature for 15 minutes on the rack.
steps.description: Don't worry, it won't cool down during this time! This is to allow the juices to seep back into the meat and make it that bit more succulent.

steps.headline: Carve and serve the roast beef.The time has arrived to carve and serve.
steps.description: Remember to use a good, sharp carving knife to cut the meat properly.

steps.headline: Complete your roast dinner.To complete your traditional roast, we suggest you add the following: Yorkshire pudding is a typical companion to roast beef; roast potatoes; a variety of vegetables such as steamed carrots, roast parsnips or whichever take your fancy, and of course, gravy.
